_header: Devoured with dream devising in my slumber
_description: ‘A general satyre’ ascribed to William Dunbar (and also to James Inglis) — sixteen 5-line stanzas (aabab) with internal rhyme in first four lines (so ababcdcbb) including refrain, ‘Within þis land wes neuir hard nor sene’

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Doverrit in dreme devysing in my slummerHow þat this realme
                    with nobillis out of nummer…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…Sic pudding fillaris discending doun of millariswithin this
                    land wes never harde nor sene

Banna.First Lines:
Devorit with dreme devysing in my slummerHow þat this realme
                    with nobillis owt of nummer…
Banna.Last Lines:
…Off sathanis senȝie Syne sic ane vnsall
                    menȝieWithin this land was nevir hard nor sene
